title: Doctor Consultation
description: Personalized Ayurvedic health assessment and treatment planning

content.overview: Comprehensive Ayurvedic consultation with experienced practitioners to diagnose dosha imbalances and create personalized treatment plans.
content.procedure:
Includes:
- Detailed health history analysis
- Nadi Pariksha (pulse diagnosis)
- Tongue and eye examination
- Personalized treatment protocol
- Follow-up planning

content.overview: Abhyanga is a foundational Ayurvedic therapy involving synchronized massage with warm herbal oils. This ancient practice balances Vata dosha, improves circulation, and promotes detoxification through the lymphatic system.
benefits: Enhances blood circulation and lymphatic drainage
Nourishes tissues and improves skin texture
Reduces stress and promotes deep relaxation
content.procedure: The treatment begins with a whole-body massage using medicated oils selected according to dosha balance. Therapists use rhythmic strokes following the direction of hair growth, focusing on marma points (vital energy points).

title: Swedana
description: Herbal steam therapy for toxin elimination

content.overview: Swedana is a specialized fomentation therapy that uses medicated steam to open channels (srotas) and facilitate toxin removal through sweating.
benefits: Relieves muscle stiffness and joint pain
content.procedure: After oil application, patient sits in a steam chamber with herbal decoctions. Steam is administered for 15-45 minutes based on constitution.

title: Basti
description: Medicated enema therapy for colon health

content.overview: Vasti is the most important Panchakarma therapy, administering herbal decoctions/oils through the rectal route to balance Vata dosha.
content.procedure:
Two main types:
1. Niruha Vasti (herbal decoction enema)
2. Anuvasana Vasti (oil enema)
Administered in series after proper preparation

content.overview: Nasyam cleanses and rejuvenates the upper respiratory tract through nasal instillation of medicated oils/powders.
content.procedure: After facial massage, 5-8 drops of medicated oil are administered in each nostril followed by steam inhalation

title: Udwartanam
description: Herbal powder massage for detoxification and weight management

content.overview: Udwartanam is a unique Ayurvedic therapy using medicated herbal powders to perform deep tissue massage. This treatment helps break down cellulite and improves lymphatic drainage.
content.procedure: Therapist applies special herbal powders in upward strokes using specific pressure techniques. Followed by steam therapy to enhance detoxification.

title: Takradhara
description: Medicated buttermilk stream therapy for neurological health

content.overview: Takradhara involves continuous pouring of medicated buttermilk over the forehead to calm the nervous system and balance Pitta dosha.
content.procedure: Warm medicated buttermilk is poured in a continuous stream over the forehead using special vessel (Dhara patra) for 30-45 minutes.

content.overview: Specialized care regimen for expecting mothers focusing on optimal fetal development and maternal health through Ayurvedic nutrition and therapies.
content.procedure:
Customized plan including:
- Garbhini Paricharya (pregnancy regimen)
- Safe herbal supplements
- Prenatal yoga
- Diet planning
- Stress management

content.overview: Traditional 40-day recovery program (Sutika Paricharya) focusing on maternal recovery, lactation support, and hormonal balance.
content.procedure:
Includes:
- Specialized abdominal massages
- Herbal sitz baths
- Lactogenic diet
- Uterine tonification
- Bonding therapies

content.overview: Specialized Netra Chikitsa (eye treatments) using herbal preparations and therapies to improve vision and treat eye disorders.
content.procedure:
Includes:
- Netra Tarpana (medicated ghee pooling)
- Aschyotana (eye drops)
- Vidalaka (herbal paste application)
- Eye yoga exercises

content.overview: Panchakarma is Ayurveda's premier detox protocol involving five purification therapies. This intensive program removes deep-seated toxins (ama) and restores mind-body equilibrium.
benefits: Deep tissue detoxification at cellular level
content.procedure:
Three-phase process:
1. Purvakarma (Preparation): Oil massages and steam therapy
2. Pradhanakarma (Main Therapies): Vamana, Virechana, Basti, Nasya, Raktamokshana
3. Paschatkarma (Post-care): Dietary regimen and lifestyle counseling

title: Ayurveda Massage
description: Traditional Ayurvedic massages tailored to individual needs

content.overview: Customized Ayurvedic massage therapies using medicated oils and techniques specific to individual dosha balance and health requirements.
benefits: Promotes deep relaxation and stress relief
content.procedure:
Therapist selects oils and techniques based on dosha analysis. Includes:
- Abhyanga (full body)
- Marma point stimulation
- Shirodhara (oil stream on forehead)
- Pinda Sweda (herbal bolus massage)
